author: Special Correspondent
text:
A large number of people pulled the temple car belonging to Sri Mariamman temple in Tiruvappur near here on Monday.

The annual festival began with “poochorithal” on February 21 when individuals, associations and institutions offered baskets of flowers to the presiding deity. Special ‘alankaram’ was performed to the presiding deity since then marking the festival.

The processional idol of Sri Mariamman was brought to the temple car at 4 p.m. where special puja was performed. Amidst religious fervour, people pulled the temple car. Many of them were seen offering ‘milk kavadi’ in fulfilment of their vows.

The district administration had declared a local holiday on Monday for government departments and educational institutions.
title: Mariamman car festival celebrated at Tiruvappur
